definition: to talk about often/to reminisce about/to keep repeating/to keep harping on/to discuss

to read/to study (a subject)/to attend (a school)/to read aloud/to give (sb) a tongue-lashing (CL:頓|顿[dun4])/to miss (sb)/idea/remembrance/twenty (banker's anti-fraud numeral corresponding to 廿[nian4])
variant of 念[nian4], to read aloud

sentences.english: Presently, Topics of cars are hanging on my lips. One in three words escaping from my lips has something to do with cars.
sentences.chinese: 现在，嘴边常常念叨着车，三句话离不开车的话题。

sentences.english: I'll send you work sheet by email somedays later.
sentences.chinese: 我给你的工作表后通过电子邮件日子她念叨着。

sentences.english: During the meeting, Tom kept murmuring about his salary.
sentences.chinese: 开会期间，汤姆喋喋不休地念叨着他的工资。

sentences.english: She's been going on about getting jewellery for weeks.
sentences.chinese: 她念叨要买首饰念叨了好几个星期了。

sentences.english: She's been going on about getting jewellery for weeks.
sentences.chinese: 她念叨要买首饰念叨了好几个星期了。

sentences.english: Night, Xiao Hui drink got wasted, chanting the king and queen were changed.
sentences.chinese: 晚上，萧辉喝的大醉，念叨着大王和王后都变了。

sentences.english: This is the Uncle Zhang we're always talking about.
sentences.chinese: 他就是我们常常念叨的张大伯。

sentences.english: Jim plays with her. His eyes close.
sentences.chinese: 吉姆这么念叨着她，闭着眼睛。

sentences.english: She raises hands, the inside doesn't know to be reading Dao what.
sentences.chinese: 她举起双手，口里不知道在念叨什么。

sentences.english: Bridal chamber, drunken j&js mouth constantly chanting the names of the seven sister.
sentences.chinese: 洞房中，酒醉的强生嘴里不断念叨七妹的名字。

sentences.english: People do not need to talk about you everyday.
sentences.chinese: 他们不用每天念叨着你。

sentences.english: That toe never did straighten out and Father talked of it often.
sentences.chinese: 那只脚趾再也没变直过来，父亲经常念叨着这件事。

sentences.english: Han Jia, what are you muttering?
I repeated to myself Anthony's words, catching his accent, soundlessly.
sentences.chinese: 我暗自念叨着安东尼的话，默默地学他的语调。

definition: to be chattersome/to talk on and on without stopping/to nag
long-winded/garrulous/to talk endlessly without getting to the point
to argue noisily/to shout/to make widely known/to reproach
to read silently/to mouth (the words of a prayer etc)/to say to oneself/to contemplate inwardly
to talk to oneself/to think aloud/to soliloquize
